Paper.Title: Sydney, July 2006. c(c)2006 Association for Computational Linguistics Word Sense and Subjectivity

Section.Paragraph: Subjectivity and meaning are both important properties of language. This paper explores their interaction, and brings empirical evidence in support of the hypotheses that (1) subjectivity is a property that can be associated with word senses, and (2) word sense disambiguation can directly benefit from subjectivity annotations.
